name: Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo

reviews.text: I have stayed here now a few times and it is absolutely perfect. Arriving in the lobby on the 38th floor with a view of Tokyo all around you through the glass windows is surreal. The staff makes you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. The rooms, the service, the spa, and the gym are all top notch. You can't go wrong with a stay here.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: I stayed at the Mandarin for 3 nights in January and it was wonderful. After being stuck in traffic on the yellow bus for 2 hours, it was a relief to see the room!
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the MO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with another reviewer, MO beats the Park Hyatt hands down. The hotel is very conveniently located and is right ontop of the subway station.
reviews.title: PERFECT in EVERY way!

likes.liked: — Too many things -location, Metro in basement, stunning rooms ....
likes.disliked: — Had to pay for steam room and internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom, bathroom, view (could see Mt Fuji!), and service were excellent. LOVE the bulgari white tea bath products :)
reviews.title: Lost in Translation indeed

reviews.text: Just returned from Tokyo and I cannot write enough good things about this BEAUTIFUL hotel. The location is excellent - there is the Metro in the basement which makes it very easy to travel around Tokyo. The staff are incredibly helpful with queries you have and advice on planning your site seeing (or cherry blossom viewing). The rooms are STUNNING!!! SUCH attention to detail. Big room, wonderful bathroom. It was difficult to actually LEAVE the room it was so nice. The view was spectacular. We could see Mount Fiji and the Tokyo skyscrapers. This has to be one of the BEST city hotels I have stayed in. VERY impressed! Would def want to stay here again!
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favorite hotel chain is the Mandarin Oriental. And this one is a perfect example why. It made our Tokyo visit just marvelous. Service is top-notch. Terrific room with stunning views. Quality, first-rate furnishings and beddings. Heated toilet seat! Spa was magnificent. Over-all first class.
reviews.title: Excellent, Splendid, Superb Hotel
Incredibly Good
reviews.text: This hotel deserves the fantastic reviews. Like others, we've been to other "tier one" Asian hotels. Nothing (in our experience) comes close to MOTYO.

The Concierge team in particular is masterful. They made our 4 days stay magical. They looked after every little detail, helped us to find special places that suited our desires, and responded effortlessly to tough requests at the last minute.
reviews.title: The best hotel in the world?

likes.disliked: — the food wasn't as fabulous as everything else was

reviews.title: One of the very best
reviews.text: The rooms are comfy, the food is great (although the breakfast is a bit weak). The Molecular Bar is a food experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - highly recommended!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did research tokyo hotels quite a bit before deciding on the Mandarin Oriental. Besides that this hotel is rated on this website as the #1 hotel in tokyo, I read every single review and all rated this hotel a 5.0. Notch up another 5.0 for the hotel from me.
reviews.title: This hotel is as amazing as everyone says....

reviews.text: Top notch room, service, spa, restaurants, room service, view. From the moment we arrived to when we left. Above all, you will find the concierge service here alone worth it all. Very highly recommended ! Period.
reviews.title: probably the best hotel in the world

likes.disliked: — I couldn't fault anything about this hotel at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title of this review is a bold one, but I do travel extensively for business and this is simply a flawless hotel. From the extraordinary rooms, to the food, to the peerless service, everything is *exactly* right. Budget permitting, I'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: The real best hotel in Tokyo

likes.liked: — The staff, the location, the view, the corner room, the restaurants... ALL !

reviews.title: Best service in the world!
reviews.text: Of course there's the view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Little things, like the compartment in the closet where you leave things for pickup so the staff never need to bother you when picking up or leaving things for you, make this hotel a cut above most.
reviews.title: One of the Best EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the MO for our last night in Tokyo. It was a special treat for my birthday and was truly unforgetable. We booked a great rate directly on the hotel's website, which included evening meal, in-room movies and minibar.
reviews.title: Fabulous Service

likes.disliked: — You had to pay for internet access in the business suite

reviews.text: The very attentive staff presented me with a great birthday card and balloons at dinner then more gifts when we checked out! The hotel is very sumptious and everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The decor was beautiful and the bathroom was gorgeous.
reviews.title: Incredible luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights in Tokyo at the Mandarin, and could not have asked for a better hotel. My husband and I were in a corner king room, and my parents stayed in the Premier Grand King. Both rooms were spectacular, and quite spacious by any standard. Our corner king room had windows all around and into the bathroom, and when I took my nightly scented salt-filled bath, I was able to peruse the amazing city views from the 35th floor.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

likes.liked: — The room, impeccable service, and the fabulous fitness center!!
likes.disliked: — No swimming pool; cocktail lounges too crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents' room was even bigger than ours and also enjoyed amazing city views. It would be an understatement to say that they were pleased.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven!

likes.disliked: — charges for the sauna, bar/restaurant management

reviews.text: There was an artfully presented snack left for us in the room each afternoon which was quite unexpected and delightful.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, wish I could live there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There isn't enough praise that I can lavish on this hotel and its wonderful staff. We spent four glorious nights at the Mandarin Oriental over the Thanksgiving holiday. Being a kitchen and bath designer, I was anxious to see the much lauded bedroom and bath design. I wasn't disappointed. Many people assume that minimalist design is cold, sparse and uninviting. These rooms are high end luxury at its finest. Elegant materials, warm woods, special touches, and sound proofing make you want to stay forever. And the bathrooms? Wow.....you can't beat the combo of Asian design and German engineering (the shower and lavatory plumbing are HansGrohe from Germany). The Japanese Toto toilet took some getting used to, but that heated seat was a real treat! Probably the most comfortable bed/pillow combo I've ever enjoyed in a hotel and the linens were as high end as I had expected.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

likes.liked: — High end luxury materials used througout.

reviews.text: The staff were polite, attentive and unobtrusive. The staff at the Concierge desk were extraordinarily knowledgeable and helpful for much more than dinner reservations!
reviews.title: Among The Best In The World

reviews.text: The public rooms are utterly amazing. The three stacked fireplaces were picture-worthy! And the view of downtown Tokyo exceeded all expectations.
reviews.title: Nothing is a problem at this wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: Treat yourself to something extraordinary and stay at this wonderful hotel!
reviews.title: No exaggeration...this place is worth all the hype.

likes.liked: — Everything was amazing...but the views will take your breath away.

reviews.text: I will be brief, as others have already provided ample praise for this spectacular place. On the pricey side, but well worth it. Great location, wonderfully helpful staff, incredibly quiet rooms, staff will cater to your every need. Probably the most comfortable bed/pillow ever. Highly recommended. The heated toilet seat, with electronic controls for "rear cleansing" and "front cleansing" was a new one on me.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in the World

likes.disliked: — Location could be a little better, but very minor point

reviews.text: During a recent business trip to Tokyo, I chose the Mandarin Oriental that I found the hotel to be an excellent choice and just another wonderful property from this hotel chain.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The lobby was beautifully decorated with views of Tokyo and the room was modern with every amenity once could want.
reviews.title: Awesome experience at MO

reviews.text: This hotel met all of my expectations and would certainly visit again when in Tokyo.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: Stayed at the MO from 30 May till 1 June and then from 3 June till 6 June. We have stayed in many top hotels, and we just expected another 5-star hotel experience. As our cab approached the hotel driveway, the doormen were already enthusiastically waving to our cab, ushering it to stop where they were all eagerly waiting and with great efficiency, they unloaded the bags from the boot even before we paid the cab fare. We were greeted with warm welcomes and ushered to the 38th floor where the reception desk was. After a quick check in, we were shown to our room. Amex Centurion has a stay 2 nites, pay 1 nite promo at all MO hotels, valid for once a year and we took advantage of that. We were upgraded to the premier king room but decided to splurge on the executive suite for an extra 20,000 yen. It was very spacious, the bathroom had a free standing bath and a huge shower with seating for 2 people in it! The bed wasnt a full king, my only grouse for the price we were paying, we should have a full king bed. Broadband access is free, huge flat screen tvs, and very plush coverings.
reviews.title: A Little Slice of Nirvana

likes.disliked: — There was nothing that wasn't spot on.

reviews.text: But the reason why i am writing this review is not because of the room, many good hotels have this too. Its the MO service that we are most impressed with. We have never experienced a level of service that "goes the extra mile" as we did here at MO. We were going to Izu, a 3 hour train ride out of Tokyo and altho I had done my research on the internet, we still had a few queries about getting there. The train schedule seemed to indicate that we needed to transfer trains but other sites said diff things. We checked with the front desk at MO and immed the man there, a very helpful Mr Takashi, offered to help me decipher and make out the route there. He took my train schedule and other info, made a copy and said he would get back to me. In less than 2 hours, they slid a note under our door and said that they would be happy to purchase the train tickets for us for the journey there and back to Tokyo. Of course we said yes please, and an hour later, the train tickets were sitting at the front desk waiting for me
reviews.title: splurge worthy

reviews.text: The hotel lobby is fabulous. I was not sure if I should go here or to another hotel, but I decided to check out MO. The hotel rooms are probably better at the Peninsula Tokyo but the bar, the ambience, the service at MO is absolutely fantastic. The best contemporary chic designed hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful experience at Mandarin Oriental

likes.liked: — The Bar, The Lobby with fire and ice and water combination Perfectly ZEN atmosphere
likes.disliked: — using elevator to get to lobby unlike Peninsula Tokyo.

reviews.text: There have been so many wonderful reviews for this hotel, I am a little hesitant to repeat them again, but just having returned from a week in Tokyo, I have to share this experience.
reviews.title: The people make the difference, simply wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A family of three, we spend a lot of time travelling all around the world. This was however our first trip to Japan. I choose the MO because of all the great reviews. Therefore, our expectations were extremely high.
reviews.title: Heaven on the 38th floor

likes.disliked: — You have to return to the 38th floor to take another elevator down to the ground level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Premisis -
reviews.title: Astonishingly good.

likes.liked: — The continuous feeling of high quality, luxury and service.
likes.disliked: — It's very nearly flawless, so nothing significant.

reviews.text: About the building , the entrance, the lobby, spas , rooms , bars etc, all I can say is that I was flabbergasted. I have worked before on several hotel building projects, and I have a tendency to look at the quality of craftmanship in the design and fitting. I try to see where they have cut the corners, or made a small mistake. After spending a week at the MO in Tokyo, I found nothing! Although it seems not possible to me, they did not cut any corners! They have simply taken the best materials available, and applied them in an absolutely fantastic solution. I am not talking about one part of the hotel, I mean everywhere. From the entrance door to the bathrooms, it is perfect. (Small tip - have a look at the floor in the elevators or the stairs going from the lobby down to the bar. It is a black marble, but look for the blue highlights which shimmer in the day light. Amazing touch!)
reviews.title: Excellent
In a different league
reviews.text: Having stayed at some of the most expensive five stars hotels around the World, I can confidently say that Mandarin Oriental Tokyo really does deliver to a level that puts it in a league of its own. Everything from the hotel facilities, location, customer service and room size is absolutely superb. The only drawdown to a MO that really got it right is the spa treatment prices which are VERY high by any international standard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely be choosing to return next time in Tokyo.
reviews.title: don't miss it

reviews.text: Staying here is a real experience - we booked for the view and it was defiinitely worth it !
reviews.title: The best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were flawless: Perfectly comfortable bed, very nice and high quality furniture and a fantastic view from everywhere (including the bath room). Shower and bath were both extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

likes.liked: — Quality of furnishings, food and service!
likes.disliked: — Leaving before we had a chance to sample more of the delicious cocktails!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great from arrival to departure. The assistance provided for organizing our onward journey was just exceptional.
reviews.title: A truly magnificent memory

description: A dramatic impression awaits you up upon your arrival at Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. Sped 38 floors up by private elevator step out into our extraordinary lobby surrounded by glass and enjoy a panorama of Tokyo city. That stunning sight is offered at every opportunity; bringing a remarkable sense of space to all our 179 rooms and suites, offering a spectacular backdrop for our restaurants, bars and our spa in the sky.
